page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA.
page.content: Area is mainly gently undulating farmland with crops of wheat, barley, turnips, rape and grass. Many farms have livestock, mainly dairy cattle with some beef cattle,sheep,pigs.There are 2 main areas of population. West side of Warwick has large estates of older houses in the centre and south with a large block of modern houses on Woodloes Estate to the North. The village of Hampton Magna consists of about 6OO houses built on site of Budbrooke Barracks. Hampton on the Hill is an old village with some new houses. There are a few sites of light industry in Warwick. Crossing the area are 2 busy trunk roads, the A41 Birmingham Road and the A46 Warwick By-pass. The Grand Union Canal with famous Hatton Steps (21 locks) and railway follow line of A41. Few planes fly overhead, a peaceful rural area.
